reviewText: My 15th purchase of Midsomer Murders and they all add up to pure enjoyment.
everything was fine, just like the old series better. thanks
Great series.  My husband just loves the Midsomer Murder Mysteries.  It came quickly and I will order from this seller again.
It is Midsomer!!!!  what's not to love.
great movie

Neil Drudgeon took over as John Barnaby, Tom Barnaby's cousin, to become the chief detective of Midsomer. Their styles are different and though they share an assistant, Ben Jones, I do know that changes too. Perhaps those casting the show thought that two changes of their lead characters was too much at one time. This continues to be a superb cast of great and believable actors set in the beautiful English countryside. My only negative comment is to watch...Some of these are sold as "Series" and some as "Season" and I have duplicated more than once and received the same movies because of it.  I passed the duplicates on to friends who are now hooked on this series, too.
NO. It was a combination of sets 23 & 24 but wasn't on the info when I ordered it. So now I have wasted my money on something I already had. That is sets 23 & 24
Clever plots and interesting characters.

Beware buyers!  The second episode "Murder of Innocence" was omitted (although announced on the disc and package).  Instead, the first episode "The Dark Rider" is repeated with commentary--and I don't like to have an episode repeated, commentary or not.  I have given the lowest rating because I don't feel Acorn should take this kind of liberty--UNLESS IT IS STATED INITIALLY!  Please, Acorn, how about sending that second episode to everyone who has been deprived?
Beware this looks like is a reissue of previously sold episodes in sets now gouped under Neil Dudgeon his "series 15" not a set like #24 or #25. The episodes are good but not worth buying twice.

I have to say I was more than a bit sad to see John Nettles leave the Midsomer series. Saying that, Neil Dudgeon stepped into that space and has made it his own. I like the changes and the series still works very well---quirky characters, plots and all. A particular favorite is Sykes.
this is a gift
Another great Midsomer ...We love these

Love, love, LOVE this series! I highly recommend that you start with season 1 and work your way up. Great series to binge watch!  Love the British sense to humor!!! Midsomer Murders is a great series! They keep you guessing who did it up to the end. Barnaby ALWAYS gets the perpetrator!

I have every series,  and when John Nettles left I almost cried.  It was very emotional after so long a time.  Neil Dudgeon is a good
replacement, although his approach differs.  The mysteries remain captivating and this is quite a feat after so long a run.
Please keep going as long as you can, surely you have thousands more whose interest and anticipation remains as keen as mine.
Still miss Nettles but everyone is entitled to retirement  whether full or semi in scope
This is a great series!!!!  I highly recommend it!
Excellent reissue ; enjoying new characters.t
Just love this show. Regardless of all the cast changes over the years, it's always a hit.

Product arrived prior to ETA and in great shape.  I love this series, even though John Nettles is no longer the main star.  The real draw to this series is the crazy murders and the beautiful English countryside and towns, villages and homes.
Still a great favorite, I've loved this series since the beginning.  I appreciate the fast shipping, and quality packaging.  Thanks!!  I will continue to buy these series!
Love it!

Another well written and produced season from the people who make one of my favorite mystery series.

Mixed review- the first 14 seasons were GREAT. Then on Season 15 on Political Correctness, Globalism, Climate Change and SJWs took over. Game over. The men became stupid (white men) and minorities and women became the heroes. This is how you ruin a series.
These episodes are always enjoyable and must be for others as I think they are now in their 20 something series.

Love this show.  Watched for years with John Nettles....and watch the new series on Amazon with Neil Dudgeon.  Great story lines and the countryside is BEAUTIFUL.
Each episode is intriguing and keeps me on my toes. I hated to see John Nettles leave. He was so realistic and believable.  However, Neil Dudgeon is doing a great job replacing him.

We have watched 14 years--about 112 episodes and plan to watch all 19 years. It is the best TV program since Doc Martin. When John Nettles quit as the lead actor, we thought we wouldn't like his replacement, Neil Dudgeon. But, it is different but just as good. Highly recommended!

Made the discovery that one Barnaby had been replaced by a cousin Barnaby and I off an running on a binge watch from season 11 to Season 18.  Two or three murders per episode in quiet, bucolic English villages with the light touch only the British can give to nefarious dealings.  Murder most foul is every so decorous as the quirky denizens toss up a clue here and a clue there.  Total fun.

The stories are always well written,and has great actors
Great!
love the new boy - continues to be best mysteries around

I just love this show! I'm surprised that I have continued to watch and enjoy it even as the main characters retired and left the show. The new characters have carried on the quirky personality theme, and the fun-loving way that the mysteries are solved!

The entire series is phenomenal! An intelligent mystery series made all the better by the lack of guns in most episodes.

I was worried if I would like the series once it changed over to the new Barnaby.  I like it very much.  If anything, the show has gotten a tad more realistic.  The mysteries and the acting are superb.
I love a good mystery and this one did not disappoint  Love the whole series I have also all of them

Very enjoyable Midsomer Murder episodes. I've enjoyed all the series so far, and will continue buying later series I don't have yet. Stories are well done and the murderer's identity not all that easy to guess (at least in my case).

Wasn't sure if I'd like the new Barnaby but I do, I do!  He's a bit more cosmopolitan than his cousin John Barnaby (the previous Chief Inspeector) but he works well with Sargent Ben Jones. Despite some cast changes the writing and acting are still excellkent!

I love this series, I've been watching since day one (at least 4 victims a episode, lol ). Didn't think the new Barnaby would work in the role, but he has truly grown into it nicely.  IF you enjoy this series, you will also enjoy watching Inspector Lewis. Great series also.

unfortunately this new version of midsomer is not up to the quality and durability of the prior season. The new leading characters lack the personable nature of their predecessors, Definitely a miss in casting. I hope this is recognized and a new crew or the original people return,

Wonderful.  This series just keeps getting better after seventeen years.  The stories, stars and scenery are great.  Anyone who loves British movies will love this.

After watching all of Series 15, Neil Dudgeon plays the character John Barnaby in quite a different
way than John Nettles played Tom Barnaby. Yes, i miss John but so far Neil has done a great job.

It's taken we a while to get use to the new series....I miss the old one!, but the new series is growing on me!  I wish Ben were still on the series...he is so cute, but then again, it's getting use to the new show.  I do enjoy them, but not like I use to wait for the old series to come!
